intro: Diplostephium yahuarcochense, commonly known as the Andean milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
